item.title: Old Snow
item.description:
It’s cold today
But that’s okay
Because even though the leaves and I are falling
This autumn weather is still soft and charming
As time moves forward it does less and less harming
And things move towards harmony

I remember the old days
Those November/December cold days
When we’d walk and shiver in the winter haze
Before we ever used a word like bae

The nostalgia came and hit me hard
Gave me the energy to write these bars
And the memories of junk food dates in my car
It’s heartbreaking that we’ve become so far

There are still traces of you wherever I go
Emotions captured by falling leaves and snow
But now that we can open up to talk
I can finally let the grieving go
As long you are doing okay, and that I know

item.title: Repeat
item.description:
Don’t drink so much coffee
Before you try and sleep
You’re mind will race with thoughts
Stuck on repeat
Stuck on repeat
Stuck on repeat
And you won’t be scared
But you’ll jerk awake
Making an audible gasp for air
Stuck on repeat
On repeat
On repeat
Thoughts race faster
Like a river during downpour
Yet they go nowhere
Stuck
This is is why you
Repeat

item.title: Destined
item.description:
sunsets seen
though never captured
a time capsule in a ghost town
a snowflake that never meets the snow
holding your breath
when your house is a vacuum
all that was meant
but could not make it
and not because it couldn’t have tried

item.title: Gold Tinted Glass
item.description: Through the gold tinted glass, the man nodded his head, so I did too

item.title: Beautiful
item.description:
I want to make something beautiful
I want to be something beautiful

But there’s nothing inside me
No hint towards creativity
No passion
No pain
No hope to change
Just damned up tears
All of my magnified fears

Can these words really express me?
Break apart the walls in my head
And relieve me of this anxiety?
So terrified of society

I’ll just put the walls back up

item.title: The Next Me
item.description:
I’m terrified of the next me
And what he will do
In the ways that he does nothing

item.title: Change
item.description:
Two pills
Pop them
Crawl in
Warm bed
Empty head
Dreams of dread?
They’re all dead

But I’m not

Done growing
I keep showing
Myself I can change
Thoughts rearrange
Sometimes derange
Derail, a torn sail
Cannot bail
From this ship
I’m the captain
And the arsonist
Who started this
Fantastic mess
You thought I would accomplish less?
That low bar is a personal best
That I keep setting
Lower
And lower
Thought I’d be the limbo king by now
But all I wear are khakis and a plastic crown
Fishhooks in my cheeks to prevent a frown
From showing
Not done growing
I still change
I can’t be the same
As my old self
And my health
Neither rises
Or lowers
These lures
Keep catching me
Still got the hooks as you can see
Getting pulled in every which way direction
Cant form a proper sentence
Or ask a simple question
Most of the time
Yet I can still bust rhyme
It’s my way to pass the time
And I seem to do it fairly fine
Which is nice cuz it don’t cost me a dime
But it cost me my life
Working on things I think are important
Create code to capture meaning then store it
Stashed away from any who’d whore it
Out, to those who would misuse it
Rip the meaning right out of it’s socket
Like isolated islands bought by cruise ships
Old songs being turned into shitty pop hits
Knockoff brands for the poor misfits
Misinformation for the dumb and half wits

item.title: Asleep
item.description:
“It’s easy to write your thoughts down that way” So said the speaker - a very extroverted creature, a conversational exhibitionist with cosmic quandaries boiled down to aether, we spoke but mostly he talked - I said nothing, I wouldn’t want my spirits eradicated either. To live in the mind is to live blind - my eyes tied at the lid, tied to the skies were my mysteries hid, how easily could they shatter if I left procrastination for another matter.

I was him and he was me. We had different worlds but felt it wholly. A better form than holy, as wholly connects us by how not what we feel. We both felt that fascination, we both felt our levels of expertise over our past selves. We had learned so so much, in one form or another, and had little time already spent.

item.title: Pompous
item.description:
I am my own
That’s all that I can be
To try and find the truth?
Such a task seems necessary
But dig too deep
Extrapolate too freely
Your truths become indescribable
As they separate from reality

An old man told truth to the young,
You must be kind
Leave your hatred and quarrels behind

Others say all who are born,
Get what they deserve

But the truth of mother nature?
The truth of father time?
They are too blind
They lack our spines
But they gave us ours
made jester hats of our hearts
Wasted our empathy on the meek
While the truth that we seek
Distances itself while continue to dig deep

You don’t understand
As it is, you can’t understand
Because as it is
There is nothing to understand
When you wake
If you wake
You’ll find that your music is white noise
past your eyelids there is nothing to be seen
And there’s nothing but vagueries behind your voice

item.title: Awake
item.description:
The storm rolls through
we pick up the broken branches
the pieces of our lives
our crushed dreams
and we move on.

Disasters rarely come in twos
rarely do they come in threes
they come as the torrent
against a young heart
battered to agelessness

I begin my morning with a sunset
I clear the smoke with incense
I dance because I am watching
I cry because I’m just as helpless as anyone
but I can’t turn off the radio

And we wonder why god rested on the sabbath.

item.title: River
item.description:
My head is a river
But it’s filled up with blood
Overfilling the turns and bends
Until something new restarts the flood
And now I can’t feel anymore
No now, I don’t feel anything anymore
Until the flood comes and knock me off me feet
Sweeps me to yet another defeat
Where my heart and my head wish that they were both dead
And my body can peacefully swim along
Until all of the pain is gone

My head is a river
And now the flood settles
And I can’t find my favorite places anymore
They’ve been erased, rewritten, ignored
But as long as I stay on this river
And do t get stuck in some oxbow
I’ll be safe, free, and you’ll know
After I spend some time letting blood go

item.title: I Could...
item.description:
I could let you be mine
keep your heart wrapped up in my broken mind
I could give you gifts and words of love
To prove my worth exists far above
Expectations You once had
That fell apart once life with others got bad
I can provide comfort, I can mend wounds
I can keep us tethered, me and you
And when I soar, you may lose
As dependence on me develops a bruise on you
You’ll realize the knot I tied was really a noose
And I’ll come crashing down, along with you too
And the reasons to stay? They become too few
We will be destroyed, and will need to start anew
And i know but only one thing
your life would be better if I restarted
Without
You

item.title: Chatter
item.description:
Digital chit chatter
Wired rant and banter
A conflict comes
A conflict goes
And my solution arrives after

Digital chit chatter
On ideas that don’t matter
A thought crosses my mind
And here it will hide
To stay forever after
